item.title: Trump’s Latest Swipe at BRICS, Telsa Falls on Musk's Political Party | The Opening Trade 07/07
item.description:
President Donald Trump said he would put an additional 10% tariff on any country aligning themselves with “the Anti-American policies of BRICS,” injecting further uncertainty into global trade as the US continues to negotiate levies with many trading partners.
President Donald Trump derided Elon Musk’s announcement that the Tesla and SpaceX chief executive officer is starting a new political party, saying the US has “always been a two-party system.”
“Third parties have never worked, so he can have fun with it, but I think it’s ridiculous,” Trump told reporters on Sunday.
The Opening Trade has everything you need to know as markets open across Europe. With analysis you won't find anywhere else, we break down the biggest stories of the day and speak to top guests who have skin in the game. Hosted by Tom Mackenzie, Kriti Gupta and Valerie Tytel. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: China, EU Tensions Ramp Up, Trump's 'Anti-American' Tariff Threat | Bloomberg The Pulse 07/07
item.description:
President Donald Trump said he would put an additional 10% tariff on any country aligning themselves with “the Anti-American policies of BRICS,” injecting further uncertainty into global trade as the US continues to negotiate levies with many trading partners. The comments come as the US prepares to send tariff letters to dozens of countries in the coming days, with the Trump administration’s 90-day pause on higher duties set to expire on Wednesday. Meanwhile China hit back at the European Union’s restrictions on its medical device makers while maintaining key exceptions, adding uncertainty to ties ahead of a high-stakes summit later this month.
Today's guests: Ozan Tarman, Deutsche Bank Vice Chair of Global Macro, Joaquim Miranda Sarmento, Portuguese Finance Minister, Nadia Martin Wiggen, Svelland Capital Director (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Has UK Business Optimism Faded?
